articles.description: Putin’s bombs may be visible from the International Space Station but its cosmonauts are determined to come in peace

articles.author: Aleks Phillips
articles.title: Solar storm warning: NASA predicts direct Earth hit from 'fast' impact– Where will it hit? - Express
articles.description: A SOLAR storm is expected by astronomers to hit the planet this weekend, with scientists predicting possible areas where people may be able to see its effects.

articles.author: Ashley Strickland, CNN
articles.title: Solar Orbiter swings by the sun to unravel its mysteries - CNN International
articles.description: The Solar Orbiter mission will make its closest flyby of the sun Saturday since launching in February 2020. The spacecraft will come within 31 million miles of our star, taking images and collecting data.

articles.title: Parts of the Milky Way are much older than thought, study reveals - Space.com
articles.description: The Milky Way's thick disk is 2 billion years older than astronomers previously thought and likely formed barely 800 million years after the Big Bang, a new study based on an unusual type of star found.

articles.description: A wild dolphin named Kylie may be able to “converse” with porpoises, a striking example of cross-species communication.
articles.content:
On Scotlands west coast is the Firth of Clyde, a large saltwater inlet home to thousands of harbor porpoisesand one dolphin named Kylie.

articles.author: Ian Randall
articles.title: Solar enigma: Mysterious waves spotted on Sun moving at speeds that ‘defy explanation’ - Express
articles.description: A MYSTERIOUS set of waves have been identified moving within the Sun travelling at a speed that the physicists who revealed them have said presently 'defies explanation'.
